publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4978 Brian Adam: Plight of Farepak Customers—That the Parliament notes and condemns the actions of the Farepak Christmas hamper firm in continuing to accept money from customers, despite its precarious financial position; expresses concern for those customers who will not be able to retrieve all of their lost savings; urges agents and customers of Farepak to lodge their claims for compensation with the firm’s administrators, and calls on the Scottish Executive to make representations to the UK Government to tighten up consumer protection measures so that this cannot happen again.

S2M-4978 Plight of Farepak Customers (lodged on 19 October 2006) Fergus Ewing*, Rob Gibson*, Mr John Swinney*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Tommy Sheridan*, John Swinburne*, Richard Lochhead*, Alex Fergusson*, Frances Curran*, Chris Ballance*
S2M-4978 Plight of Farepak Customers (lodged on 19 October 2006) Des McNulty*, Karen Gillon*, Carolyn Leckie*, Mrs Nanette Milne*
S2M-4978 Plight of Farepak Customers (lodged on 19 October 2006) Ms Maureen Watt*, Pauline McNeill*
S2M-4978 Plight of Farepak Customers (lodged on 19 October 2006) Trish Godman*, Roseanna Cunningham*
S2M-4978 Plight of Farepak Customers (lodged on 19 October 2006) Eleanor Scott*, Dennis Canavan*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Mr Bruce McFee*
S2M-4978 Plight of Farepak Customers (lodged on 19 October 2006) Donald Gorrie*
